body:
In the past, I've addressed this with adding Nullable annotation on the
parameter that is valid to have a null value and processing that
accordingly.

I suppose we should decide whether to allow nulls, and if we do, whether or
not to require Nullable on said param.

On Wednesday, May 15, 2013, kotya341 wrote:

> When I try to send null value by GET request with query annotation @Queryhttps://github.com/Query,
> I recieve URL like http://myUrl/?search=null&blabla
> But I think it would be correct not send null param at all.
> Can I achieve this?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/square/retrofit/issues/210
> .
So, as I understood, now retrofit will anyway send all parameters, even if some of them are null and there is no way to prevent it from sending nulls. Is it true?

yep

In the current code, the value of a query param is evaluated with
String.valueOf(argWhichMightBeNull) hence the "null" string.  This is in
RequestBuilder.build()
In older versions of retrofit, a param with a null value was simply excluded, key and all.  @JakeWharton, was this an intentional change?
I like @adriancole's suggestion of only emitting the query value 'null' if the query has been annotated Nullable. The current behaviour isn't particularly intuitive.

To be clear, I meant to add an empty value in this case, ex param= or just
param

I can do a pull request on whatever's decided.

On Saturday, May 18, 2013, Dave Johnston wrote:

> I like @adriancole https://github.com/adriancole's suggestion of only
> emitting the query value 'null' if the query has been annotated Nullable.
> The current behaviour isn't particularly intuitive.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/square/retrofit/issues/210#issuecomment-18098225
> .

Actually, can see how semantically, as a parameter we probably more likely
wish to exclude the parameter entirely if annotated with Nullable and value
is null.  This is be a better default than emitting an empty string or
"null" on null, IMHO, as both are possible simply by passing these strings
directly as the param Val.

On Saturday, May 18, 2013, Adrian Cole wrote:

> To be clear, I meant to add an empty value in this case, ex param= or just
> param
> 
> I can do a pull request on whatever's decided.
> 
> On Saturday, May 18, 2013, Dave Johnston wrote:
> 
> > I like @adriancole https://github.com/adriancole's suggestion of only
> > emitting the query value 'null' if the query has been annotated Nullable.
> > The current behaviour isn't particularly intuitive.
> > 
> > —
> > Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/square/retrofit/issues/210#issuecomment-18098225
> > .

issue.title: Handle nulls correctly for all parameters.

repository.name: retrofit
repository.description: A type-safe HTTP client for Android and the JVM
